p: Alteration of intestinal and fecal microbiota (dysbiosis), together with changes in fecal bile acid (BA) concentrations have been associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus (DM) in people. DM in dogs resembles human type 1 DM. The aim of this study was to evaluate changes in fecal microbiota and fecal unconjugated BAs profile in dogs with naturally‚Äêoccurring DM during insulin therapy and compare them to healthy control dogs (HC).
